param.name: ArduPlane:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: The identifier of this device in the MAVLink protocol

param.name: ArduPlane:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: ArduPlane:SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the main uart

param.name: ArduPlane:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: ArduPlane:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_RDDRMIX
param.documentation: The amount of rudder mix to apply during aileron movement 0 = 0 %, 1 = 100%

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_THR2PTCH
param.documentation: Throttle to pitch feed-forward gain.

param.name: ArduPlane:STICK_MIXING
param.documentation: When enabled, this adds user stick input to the control surfaces in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of flight control without changing modes. There are two types of stick mixing available. If you set STICK_MIXING to 1 then it will use "fly by wire" mixing, which controls the roll and pitch in the same way that the FBWA mode does. This is the safest option if you usually fly ArduPlane in FBWA or FBWB mode. If you set STICK_MIXING to 2 then it will enable direct mixing mode, which is what the STABILIZE mode uses. That will allow for much more extreme maneuvers while in AUTO mode.

param.name: ArduPlane:SKIP_GYRO_CAL
param.documentation: When enabled this tells the APM to skip the normal gyroscope calibration at startup, and instead use the saved gyro calibration from the last flight. You should only enable this if you are careful to check that your aircraft has good attitude control before flying, as some boards may have significantly different gyro calibration between boots, especially if the temperature changes a lot. If gyro calibration is skipped then APM relies on using the gyro drift detection code to get the right gyro calibration in the few minutes after it boots. This option is mostly useful where the requirement to hold the plane still while it is booting is a significant problem.

param.name: ArduPlane:AUTO_FBW_STEER
param.documentation: When enabled this option gives FBWA navigation and steering in AUTO mode. This can be used to allow manual stabilised piloting with waypoint logic for triggering payloads. With this enabled the pilot has the same control over the plane as in FBWA mode, and the normal AUTO navigation is completely disabled. This option is not recommended for normal use.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MINSPD
param.documentation: Minimum GPS ground speed in m/s used by the speed check that un-suppresses throttle in auto-takeoff. This can be be used for catapult launches where you want the motor to engage only after the plane leaves the catapult, but it is preferable to use the TKOFF_THR_MINACC and TKOFF_THR_DELAY parameters for cvatapult launches due to the errors associated with GPS measurements. For hand launches with a pusher prop it is strongly advised that this parameter be set to a value no less than 4 m/s to provide additional protection against premature motor start. Note that the GPS velocity will lag the real velocity by about 0.5 seconds. The ground speed check is delayed by the TKOFF_THR_DELAY parameter.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MINACC
param.documentation: Minimum forward acceleration in m/s/s before arming the ground speed check in auto-takeoff. This is meant to be used for hand launches. Setting this value to 0 disables the acceleration test which means the ground speed check will always be armed which could allow GPS velocity jumps to start the engine. For hand launches this should be set to 15.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_DELAY
param.documentation: This parameter sets the time delay (in 1/10ths of a second) that the ground speed check is delayed after the forward acceleration check controlled by TKOFF_THR_MINACC has passed. For hand launches with pusher propellers it is essential that this is set to a value of no less than 2 (0.2 seconds) to ensure that the aircraft is safely clear of the throwers arm before the motor can start.

param.name: ArduPlane:LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT
param.documentation: This controls the maximum bank angle in degrees during flight modes where level flight is desired, such as in the final stages of landing, and during auto takeoff. This should be a small angle (such as 5 degrees) to prevent a wing hitting the runway during takeoff or landing. Setting this to zero will completely disable heading hold on auto takeoff and final landing approach.

param.name: ArduPlane:land_pitch_cd
param.documentation: Used in autoland for planes without airspeed sensors in hundredths of a degree

param.name: ArduPlane:land_flare_alt
param.documentation: Altitude in autoland at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch

param.name: ArduPlane:land_flare_sec
param.documentation: Time before landing point at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch

param.name: ArduPlane:NAV_CONTROLLER
param.documentation: Which navigation controller to enable

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_MIX
param.documentation: The percent of mixing between GPS altitude and baro altitude. 0 = 100% gps, 1 = 100% baro. It is highly recommend that you not change this from the default of 1, as GPS altitude is notoriously unreliable. The only time I would recommend changing this is if you have a high altitude enabled GPS, and you are dropping a plane from a high altitude baloon many kilometers off the ground.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_CTRL_ALG
param.documentation: This sets what algorithm will be used for altitude control. The default is zero, which selects the most appropriate algorithm for your airframe. Currently the default is to use TECS (total energy control system). If you set it to 1 then you will get the old (deprecated) non-airspeed based algorithm. If you set it to 3 then you will get the old (deprecated) airspeed based algorithm. Setting it to 2 selects the new 'TECS' (total energy control system) altitude control, which currently is equivalent to setting 0. Note that TECS is able to handle aircraft both with and without an airspeed sensor.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: This is added to the target altitude in automatic flight. It can be used to add a global altitude offset to a mission

param.name: ArduPlane:CMD_TOTAL
param.documentation: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

param.name: ArduPlane:CMD_INDEX
param.documentation: The index of the currently running mission item. Do not change this manually.

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint that when crossed indicates the waypoint has been completed. To avoid the aircraft looping around the waypoint in case it misses by more than the WP_RADIUS an additional check is made to see if the aircraft has crossed a "finish line" passing through the waypoint and perpendicular to the flight path from the previous waypoint. If that finish line is crossed then the waypoint is considered complete.

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_MAX_RADIUS
param.documentation: Sets the maximum distance to a waypoint for the waypoint to be considered complete. This overrides the "cross the finish line" logic that is normally used to consider a waypoint complete. For normal AUTO behaviour this parameter should be set to zero. Using a non-zero value is only recommended when it is critical that the aircraft does approach within the given radius, and should loop around until it has done so. This can cause the aircraft to loop forever if its turn radius is greater than the maximum radius set.

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_LOITER_RAD
param.documentation: Defines the distance from the waypoint center, the plane will maintain during a loiter. If you set this value to a negative number then the default loiter direction will be counter-clockwise instead of clockwise.

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on fence breach. If this is set to 0 then no action is taken, and geofencing is disabled. If this is set to 1 then the plane will enter GUIDED mode, with the target waypoint as the fence return point. If this is set to 2 then the fence breach is reported to the ground station, but no other action is taken. If set to 3 then the plane enters guided mode but the pilot retains manual throttle control.

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of geofence points currently loaded

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_CHANNEL
param.documentation: RC Channel to use to enable geofence. PWM input above 1750 enables the geofence

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_MINALT
param.documentation: Minimum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_MAXALT
param.documentation: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:RALLY_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of rally points currently loaded

param.name: ArduPlane:ARSPD_FBW_MIN
param.documentation: Airspeed corresponding to minimum throttle in auto throttle modes (FBWB, CRUISE, AUTO, GUIDED, LOITER, CIRCLE and RTL). This is a calibrated (apparent) airspeed.

param.name: ArduPlane:ARSPD_FBW_MAX
param.documentation: Airspeed corresponding to maximum throttle in auto throttle modes (FBWB, CRUISE, AUTO, GUIDED, LOITER, CIRCLE and RTL). This is a calibrated (apparent) airspeed.

param.name: ArduPlane:FBWB_ELEV_REV
param.documentation: Reverse sense of elevator in FBWB and CRUISE modes. When set to 0 up elevator (pulling back on the stick) means to lower altitude. When set to 1, up elevator means to raise altitude.

param.humanName: Fly By Wire B altitude change rate
param.name: ArduPlane:FBWB_CLIMB_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in m/s at which FBWB and CRUISE modes will change its target altitude for full elevator deflection. Note that the actual climb rate of the aircraft can be lower than this, depending on your airspeed and throttle control settings. If you have this parameter set to the default value of 2.0, then holding the elevator at maximum deflection for 10 seconds would change the target altitude by 20 meters.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_SUPP_MAN
param.documentation: When throttle is supressed in auto mode it is normally forced to zero. If you enable this option, then while suppressed it will be manual throttle. This is useful on petrol engines to hold the idle throttle manually while waiting for takeoff

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_PASS_STAB
param.documentation: If this is set then when in STABILIZE, FBWA or ACRO modes the throttle is a direct passthru from the transmitter. This means the THR_MIN and THR_MAX settings are not used in these modes. This is useful for petrol engines where you setup a throttle cut switch that suppresses the throttle below the normal minimum.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_FAILSAFE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_FS_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The target percentage of throttle to apply for normal flight

param.name: ArduPlane:THROTTLE_NUDGE
param.documentation: When enabled, this uses the throttle input in auto-throttle modes to 'nudge' the throttle to higher or lower values

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_SHORT_ACTN
param.documentation: The action to take on a short (FS_SHORT_TIMEOUT) failsafe event in AUTO, GUIDED or LOITER modes. A short failsafe event in stabilization modes will always cause an immediate change to CIRCLE mode. In AUTO mode you can choose whether it will enter CIRCLE mode or continue with the mission. If FS_SHORT_ACTN is 0 then it will continue with the mission, if it is 1 then it will enter CIRCLE mode, and then enter RTL if the failsafe condition persists for FS_LONG_TIMEOUT seconds. If it is set to 2 then the plane will enter FBWA mode with zero throttle and level attitude to glide in.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_SHORT_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition has to persist before a short failsafe event will occor. This defaults to 1.5 seconds

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_LONG_ACTN
param.documentation: The action to take on a long (FS_LONG_TIMEOUT seconds) failsafe event in AUTO, GUIDED or LOITER modes. A long failsafe event in stabilization modes will always cause an RTL (ReturnToLaunch). In AUTO modes you can choose whether it will RTL or continue with the mission. If FS_LONG_ACTN is 0 then it will continue with the mission, if it is 1 then it will enter RTL mode. Note that if FS_SHORT_ACTN is 1, then the aircraft will enter CIRCLE mode after FS_SHORT_TIMEOUT seconds of failsafe, and will always enter RTL after FS_LONG_TIMEOUT seconds of failsafe, regardless of the FS_LONG_ACTN setting. If FS_LONG_ACTN is set to 2 then instead of using RTL it will enter a FBWA glide with zero throttle.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_LONG_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition has to persist before a long failsafe event will occor. This defaults to 20 seconds

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage then the plane will RTL

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the plane will RTL

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_GCS_ENABL
param.documentation: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. Failsafe will trigger after 20 seconds of no MAVLink heartbeat messages. WARNING: Enabling this option opens up the possibility of your plane going into failsafe mode and running the motor on the ground it it loses contact with your ground station. If this option is enabled on an electric plane then either use a separate motor arming switch or remove the propeller in any ground testing.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_ROLL_CD
param.documentation: The maximum commanded bank angle in either direction

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum commanded pitch up angle

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_PITCH_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum commanded pitch down angle

param.name: ArduPlane:ACRO_ROLL_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum roll rate at full stick deflection in ACRO mode

param.name: ArduPlane:ACRO_PITCH_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum pitch rate at full stick deflection in ACRO mode

param.name: ArduPlane:ACRO_LOCKING
param.documentation: Enable attitude locking when sticks are released

param.name: ArduPlane:GROUND_STEER_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude at which to use the ground steering controller on the rudder. If non-zero then the STEER2SRV controller will be used to control the rudder for altitudes within this limit of the home altitude.

param.name: ArduPlane:GROUND_STEER_DPS
param.documentation: Ground steering rate in degrees per second for full rudder stick deflection

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_AUTO
param.documentation: Set RC trim PWM levels to current levels when switching away from manual mode. When this option is enabled and you change from MANUAL to any other mode then the APM will take the current position of the control sticks as the trim values for aileron, elevator and rudder. It will use those to set RC1_TRIM, RC2_TRIM and RC4_TRIM. This option is disabled by default as if a pilot is not aware of this option and changes from MANUAL to another mode while control inputs are not centered then the trim could be changed to a dangerously bad value. You can enable this option to assist with trimming your plane, by enabling it before takeoff then switching briefly to MANUAL in flight, and seeing how the plane reacts. You can then switch back to FBWA, trim the surfaces then again test MANUAL mode. Each time you switch from MANUAL the APM will take your control inputs as the new trim. After you have good trim on your aircraft you can disable TRIM_AUTO for future flights.

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_MIXING
param.documentation: Enable elevon mixing on both input and output. To enable just output mixing see the ELEVON_OUTPUT option.

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_REVERSE
param.documentation: Reverse elevon mixing

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_CH1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse elevon channel 1

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_CH2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse elevon channel 2

param.name: ArduPlane:VTAIL_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Enable VTail output in software. If enabled then the APM will provide software VTail mixing on the elevator and rudder channels. There are 4 different mixing modes available, which refer to the 4 ways the elevator can be mapped to the two VTail servos. Note that you must not use VTail output mixing with hardware pass-through of RC values, such as with channel 8 manual control on an APM1. So if you use an APM1 then set FLTMODE_CH to something other than 8 before you enable VTAIL_OUTPUT. Please also see the MIXING_GAIN parameter for the output gain of the mixer.

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Enable software elevon output mixer. If enabled then the APM will provide software elevon mixing on the aileron and elevator channels. There are 4 different mixing modes available, which refer to the 4 ways the elevator can be mapped to the two elevon servos. Note that you must not use elevon output mixing with hardware pass-through of RC values, such as with channel 8 manual control on an APM1. So if you use an APM1 then set FLTMODE_CH to something other than 8 before you enable ELEVON_OUTPUT. Please also see the MIXING_GAIN parameter for the output gain of the mixer.

param.name: ArduPlane:MIXING_GAIN
param.documentation: The gain for the Vtail and elevon output mixers. The default is 0.5, which ensures that the mixer doesn't saturate, allowing both input channels to go to extremes while retaining control over the output. Hardware mixers often have a 1.0 gain, which gives more servo throw, but can saturate. If you don't have enough throw on your servos with VTAIL_OUTPUT or ELEVON_OUTPUT enabled then you can raise the gain using MIXING_GAIN. The mixer allows outputs in the range 900 to 2100 microseconds.

param.name: ArduPlane:SYS_NUM_RESETS
param.documentation: Number of APM board resets

param.name: ArduPlane:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Two byte bitmap of log types to enable in dataflash

param.name: ArduPlane:RST_SWITCH_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

param.name: ArduPlane:RST_MISSION_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset the mission to the first waypoint. When this channel goes above 1750 the mission is reset. Set RST_MISSION_CH to 0 to disable.

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_ARSPD_CM
param.documentation: Airspeed in cm/s to aim for when airspeed is enabled in auto mode. This is a calibrated (apparent) airspeed.

param.humanName: speed used for speed scaling calculations
param.name: ArduPlane:SCALING_SPEED
param.documentation: Airspeed in m/s to use when calculating surface speed scaling. Note that changing this value will affect all PID values

param.name: ArduPlane:MIN_GNDSPD_CM
param.documentation: Minimum ground speed in cm/s when under airspeed control

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_PITCH_CD
param.documentation: offset to add to pitch - used for in-flight pitch trimming. It is recommended that instead of using this parameter you level your plane correctly on the ground for good flight attitude.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_HOLD_RTL
param.documentation: Return to launch target altitude. This is the altitude the plane will aim for and loiter at when returning home. If this is negative (usually -1) then the plane will use the current altitude at the time of entering RTL.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_HOLD_FBWCM
param.documentation: This is the minimum altitude in centimeters that FBWB and CRUISE modes will allow. If you attempt to descend below this altitude then the plane will level off. A value of zero means no limit.

param.name: ArduPlane:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_1_PERCNT
param.documentation: The percentage change in flap position when FLAP_1_SPEED is reached. Use zero to disable flaps

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_1_SPEED
param.documentation: The speed in meters per second at which to engage FLAP_1_PERCENT of flaps. Note that FLAP_1_SPEED should be greater than or equal to FLAP_2_SPEED

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_2_PERCNT
param.documentation: The percentage change in flap position when FLAP_2_SPEED is reached. Use zero to disable flaps

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_2_SPEED
param.documentation: The speed in meters per second at which to engage FLAP_2_PERCENT of flaps. Note that FLAP_1_SPEED should be greater than or equal to FLAP_2_SPEED

param.name: ArduPlane:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: ArduPlane:INVERTEDFLT_CH
param.documentation: A RC input channel number to enable inverted flight. If this is non-zero then the APM will monitor the correcponding RC input channel and will enable inverted flight when the channel goes above 1750.

param.name: ArduPlane:HIL_SERVOS
param.documentation: This controls whether real servo controls are used in HIL mode. If you enable this then the APM will control the real servos in HIL mode. If disabled it will report servo values, but will not output to the real servos. Be careful that your motor and propeller are not connected if you enable this option.

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_MREV
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows reconising the mavlink version

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduCopter:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: ArduCopter:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The minimum altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the sonar. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the sonar

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_TYPE
param.documentation: Used to adjust scaling to match the sonar used (only Maxbotix sonars are supported at this time)

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_GAIN
param.documentation: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the copter

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage then the plane will RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the plane will RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GPS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when gps signal is lost

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value below which represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: ArduCopter:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduCopter:FLOW_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

param.name: ArduCopter:SUPER_SIMPLE
param.documentation: Enabling this turn on one of the Super Simple Mode variants. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT_FINAL
param.documentation: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

param.name: ArduCopter:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
param.documentation: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_TOTAL
param.documentation: Total number of commands in the mission stored in the eeprom. Do not update this parameter directly!

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_INDEX
param.documentation: The index number of the command that is currently being executed. Do not update this parameter directly!

param.name: ArduCopter:CIRCLE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

param.name: ArduCopter:CIRCLE_RATE
param.documentation: Circle mode's turn rate in degrees / second. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_LOIT_TIME
param.documentation: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before begining final descent

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle that will be sent to the motors to keep them spinning

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle that will be sent to the motors

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

param.name: ArduCopter:TRIM_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The autopilot's estimate of the throttle required to maintain a level hover. Calculated automatically from the pilot's throttle input while in stabilize mode

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MID
param.documentation: The throttle output (0 ~ 1000) when throttle stick is in mid position. Used to scale the manual throttle so that the mid throttle stick position is close to the throttle required to hover

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: ArduCopter:SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

param.name: ArduCopter:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 2 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduCopter:TOY_RATE
param.documentation: Controls yaw rate in Toy mode. Higher values will cause a slower yaw rate. Do not set to zero!

param.name: ArduCopter:ESC
param.documentation: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE
param.documentation: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_LOW
param.documentation: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_HIGH
param.documentation: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

param.name: ArduCopter:CH7_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH8_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH8 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Allows enabling or disabling of pre-arming checks of receiver, accelerometer, barometer and compass

param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_FF
param.documentation: Rate Pitch Feed Forward (for TradHeli Only)

param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_FF
param.documentation: Rate Roll Feed Forward (for TradHeli Only)

param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_FF
param.documentation: Rate Yaw Feed Forward (for TradHeli Only)

param.name: ArduCopter:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.humanName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_RP_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_YAW_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO, Stabilize and SPORT modes. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Type of trainer used in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:LED_MODE
param.documentation: bitmap to control the copter led mode

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_D
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_P
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the latitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_I
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the latitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_D
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

param.humanName: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_P
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the longitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_I
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the longitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_D
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_P
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_I
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical speed and actual speed

param.humanName: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the desired acceleration that the I gain will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_D
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_P
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_I
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.humanName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_D
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_P
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a roll angle

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_I
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently rolling left or right

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll angle that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_D
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the roll direction

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_P
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a pitch angle

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_I
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently pitching left or right

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch angle that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_D
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the pitch direction

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired roll angle and actual angle

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired pitch angle and actual angle

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired yaw angle and actual angle

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum yaw rate that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_P
param.documentation: Altitude controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_I
param.documentation: Altitude controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired altitude and actual altitude

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_IMAX
param.documentation: Altitude controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum climb rate rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_P
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_I
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term distance (in latitude) to the target location

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Loiter longitude position controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_P
param.documentation: Loiter longitude position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the longitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter longitude rate controller

param.humanName: Loiter longitude position controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_I
param.documentation: Loiter longitude position controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term distance (in longitude direction) to the target location

param.humanName: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

param.name: APMrover2:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Two byte bitmap of log types to enable in dataflash

param.name: APMrover2:RST_SWITCH_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

param.name: APMrover2:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver. Usuallly used in combination with when AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN or AUTO_KICKSTART.

param.name: APMrover2:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_THIS_MAV
param.documentation: ID used in MAVLink protocol to identify this vehicle

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: ID used in MAVLink protocol to identify the controlling ground station

param.name: APMrover2:SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the first serial port

param.name: APMrover2:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: APMrover2:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: APMrover2:MAG_ENABLED
param.documentation: This should be set to 1 if a compass is installed

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_KICKSTART
param.documentation: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

param.humanName: Target cruise speed in auto modes
param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_SPEED
param.documentation: The target speed in auto missions.

param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_TURN_GAIN
param.documentation: The percentage to reduce the throttle while turning. If this is 100% then the target speed is not reduced while turning. If this is 50% then the target speed is reduced in proportion to the turn rate, with a reduction of 50% when the steering is maximally deflected.

param.humanName: Distance to turn to start reducing speed
param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_TURN_DIST
param.documentation: The distance to the next turn at which the rover reduces its target speed by the SPEED_TURN_GAIN

param.name: APMrover2:CH7_OPTION
param.documentation: What to do use channel 7 for

param.name: APMrover2:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This is mostly useful for rovers with internal combustion motors, to prevent the motor from cutting out in auto mode.

param.name: APMrover2:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This can be used to prevent overheating a ESC or motor on an electric rover.

param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

param.name: APMrover2:THR_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second. A value of zero means no limit.

param.name: APMrover2:SKID_STEER_OUT
param.documentation: Set this to 1 for skid steering controlled rovers (tank track style). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

param.name: APMrover2:SKID_STEER_IN
param.documentation: Set this to 1 for skid steering input rovers (tank track style in RC controller). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

param.name: APMrover2:FS_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on a failsafe event

param.name: APMrover2:FS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: How long a failsafe event need to happen for before we trigger the failsafe action

param.name: APMrover2:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel to a low value. This can be used to detect the RC transmitter going out of range. Failsafe will be triggered when the throttle channel goes below the FS_THR_VALUE for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

param.name: APMrover2:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers.

param.name: APMrover2:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. When enabled the Rover will execute the FS_ACTION when it fails to receive MAVLink heartbeat packets for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_TRIGGER_CM
param.documentation: The distance from an obstacle in centimeters at which the sonar triggers a turn to avoid the obstacle

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_TURN_ANGLE
param.documentation: The course deviation in degrees to apply while avoiding an obstacle detected with the sonar. A positive number means to turn right, and a negative angle means to turn left.

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_TURN_TIME
param.documentation: The amount of time in seconds to apply the SONAR_TURN_ANGLE after detecting an obstacle.

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_DEBOUNCE
param.documentation: The number of 50Hz sonar hits needed to trigger an obstacle avoidance event. If you get a lot of false sonar events then raise this number, but if you make it too large then it will cause lag in detecting obstacles, which could cause you go hit the obstacle.

param.name: APMrover2:LEARN_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for learning waypoints

param.name: APMrover2:MODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for driving mode control

param.name: APMrover2:MODE1
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE2
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE3
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE4
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE5
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE6
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

param.name: APMrover2:WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the rover will turn along the next waypoint path.

param.name: APMrover2:TURN_MAX_G
param.documentation: The maximum turning acceleration (in units of gravities) that the rover can handle while remaining stable. The navigation code will keep the lateral acceleration below this level to avoid rolling over or slipping the wheels in turns

param.name: GND_ABS_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: GND_TEMP
param.documentation: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

param.name: GND_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for relay control.

param.name: RC1_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC2_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC2_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC3_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC3_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC3_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC3_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC3_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC4_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC4_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC4_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC4_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC4_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC5_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC5_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC5_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC5_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC5_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC5_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC6_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC6_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC6_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC6_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC6_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC6_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC7_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC7_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC7_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC7_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC7_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC7_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC8_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC8_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC8_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC8_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC8_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC8_FUNCTION

param.name: RC9_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC9_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC9_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC9_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC9_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC9_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC12_TRIM
