param.name: RLL2SRV_T_CONST
param.documentation: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved bank angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

param.name: RLL2SRV_P
param.documentation: This is the gain from bank angle to aileron. This gain works the same way as the P term in the old PID (RLL2SRV_P) and can be set to the same value.

param.name: RLL2SRV_D
param.documentation: This is the gain from roll rate to aileron. This adjusts the damping of the roll control loop. It has the same effect as RLL2SRV_D in the old PID controller but without the spikes in servo demands. This gain helps to reduce rolling in turbulence. It should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency roll oscillation that could overstress the airframe.

param.name: RLL2SRV_I
param.documentation: This is the gain from the integral of bank angle to aileron. It has the same effect as RLL2SRV_I in the old PID controller. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out steady offsets due to an out of trim aircraft.

param.name: RLL2SRV_RMAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum roll rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit. If this value is set too low, then the roll can't keep up with the navigation demands and the plane will start weaving. If it is set too high (or disabled by setting to zero) then ailerons will get large inputs at the start of turns. A limit of 60 degrees/sec is a good default.

param.name: RLL2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: This limits the number of degrees of aileron in centi-degrees over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 centi-degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate unless the aircraft is severely out of trim.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_TCONST
param.documentation: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved pitch angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_P
param.documentation: This is the gain from pitch angle to elevator. This gain works the same way as PTCH2SRV_P in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_D
param.documentation: This is the gain from pitch rate to elevator. This adjusts the damping of the pitch control loop. It has the same effect as PTCH2SRV_D in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value, but without the spikes in servo demands. This gain helps to reduce pitching in turbulence. Some airframes such as flying wings that have poor pitch damping can benefit from increasing this gain term. This should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency pitch oscillation that could overstress the airframe.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_I
param.documentation: This is the gain applied to the integral of pitch angle. It has the same effect as PTCH2SRV_I in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out constant offsets between demanded and measured pitch angle.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_UP
param.documentation: This sets the maximum nose up pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_DN
param.documentation: This sets the maximum nose down pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RLL
param.documentation: This is the gain term that is applied to the pitch rate offset calculated as required to keep the nose level during turns. The default value is 1 which will work for all models. Advanced users can use it to correct for height variation in turns. If height is lost initially in turns this can be increased in small increments of 0.05 to compensate. If height is gained initially in turns then it can be decreased.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: This limits the number of centi-degrees of elevator over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate for most aircraft unless they are severely out of trim or have very limited elevator control effectiveness.

param.name: YAW2SRV_SLIP
param.documentation: This is the gain from measured lateral acceleration to demanded yaw rate. It should be set to zero unless active control of sideslip is desired. This will only work effectively if there is enough fuselage side area to generate a measureable lateral acceleration when the model sideslips. Flying wings and most gliders cannot use this term. This term should only be adjusted after the basic yaw damper gain YAW2SRV_DAMP is tuned and the YAW2SRV_INT integrator gain has been set. Set this gain to zero if only yaw damping is required.

param.name: YAW2SRV_INT
param.documentation: This is the integral gain from lateral acceleration error. This gain should only be non-zero if active control over sideslip is desired. If active control over sideslip is required then this can be set to 1.0 as a first try.

param.name: YAW2SRV_DAMP
param.documentation: This is the gain from yaw rate to rudder. It acts as a damper on yaw motion. If a basic yaw damper is required, this gain term can be incremented, whilst leaving the YAW2SRV_SLIP and YAW2SRV_INT gains at zero. Note that unlike with a standard PID controller, if this damping term is zero then the integrator will also be disabled.

param.name: YAW2SRV_RLL
param.documentation: This is the gain term that is applied to the yaw rate offset calculated as required to keep the yaw rate consistent with the turn rate for a coordinated turn. The default value is 1 which will work for all models. Advanced users can use it to correct for any tendency to yaw away from or into the turn once the turn is established. Increase to make the model yaw more initially and decrease to make the model yaw less initially. If values greater than 1.1 or less than 0.9 are required then it normally indicates a problem with the airspeed calibration.

param.name: YAW2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: This limits the number of centi-degrees of rudder over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate for most aircraft unless they are severely out of trim or have very limited rudder control effectiveness.

param.name: STEER2SRV_T_CONST
param.documentation: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved bank angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

param.name: STEER2SRV_P
param.documentation: The proportional gain for steering. This should be approximately equal to the diameter of the turning circle of the vehicle at low speed and maximum steering angle

param.name: STEER2SRV_I
param.documentation: This is the gain from the integral of steering angle. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out steady offsets due to an out of trim vehicle.

param.name: STEER2SRV_D
param.documentation: This adjusts the damping of the steering control loop. This gain helps to reduce steering jitter with vibration. It should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency steering oscillation that could overstress the vehicle.

param.name: STEER2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: This limits the number of degrees of steering in centi-degrees over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 centi-degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate unless the vehicle is severely out of trim.

param.name: STEER2SRV_MINSPD
param.documentation: This is the minimum assumed ground speed in meters/second for steering. Having a minimum speed prevents osciallations when the vehicle first starts moving. The vehicle can still driver slower than this limit, but the steering calculations will be done based on this minimum speed.

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4, but must be set correctly on an APM2. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_MPU6K_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.name: ARSPD_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD_USE
param.documentation: use airspeed for flight control

param.name: ARSPD_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD_RATIO
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration ratio

param.name: ARSPD_PIN
param.documentation: The analog pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to. Set this to 0..9 for the APM2 analog pins. Set to 64 on an APM1 for the dedicated airspeed port on the end of the board. Set to 11 on PX4 for the analog airspeed port. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port. Set to 65 on the PX4 or Pixhawk for an EagleTree or MEAS I2C airspeed sensor.

param.name: ARSPD_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the APM will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%

param.name: NAVL1_PERIOD
param.documentation: Period in seconds of L1 tracking loop. This needs to be larger for less responsive airframes. The default of 30 is very conservative, and for most RC aircraft will lead to slow and lazy turns. For smaller more agile aircraft a value closer to 20 is appropriate. When tuning, change this value in small increments, as a value that is much too small (say 5 or 10 below the right value) can lead to very radical turns, and a risk of stalling.

param.name: NAVL1_DAMPING
param.documentation: Damping ratio for L1 control. Increase this in increments of 0.05 if you are getting overshoot in path tracking. You should not need a value below 0.7 or above 0.85.

param.name: TECS_CLMB_MAX
param.documentation: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand require to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than THR_MAX, then either CLMB_MAX should be increased or THR_MAX reduced.

param.name: TECS_SINK_MIN
param.documentation: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and the same airspeed as used to measure CLMB_MAX.

param.name: TECS_TIME_CONST
param.documentation: This is the time constant of the TECS control algorithm. Smaller values make it faster to respond, large values make it slower to respond.

param.name: TECS_THR_DAMP
param.documentation: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

param.name: TECS_INTEG_GAIN
param.documentation: This is the integrator gain on the control loop. Increase to increase the rate at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out

param.name: TECS_VERT_ACC
param.documentation: This is the maximum vertical acceleration either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors.

param.name: TECS_HGT_OMEGA
param.documentation: This is the cross-over frequency of the complementary filter used to fuse vertical acceleration and baro alt to obtain an estimate of height rate and height.

param.name: TECS_SPD_OMEGA
param.documentation: This is the cross-over frequency of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain a lower noise and lag estimate of airspeed.

param.name: TECS_RLL2THR
param.documentation: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

param.name: TECS_SPDWEIGHT
param.documentation: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airsped errors, but give larger height errors. A value of 1.0 gives a balanced response and is the default.

param.name: TECS_PTCH_DAMP
param.documentation: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

param.name: TECS_SINK_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft will reach the pitch angle limit first and be enable to achieve the descent rate. This should be set to a value that can be achieved at the lower pitch angle limit.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: BATT_BATT_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT_BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 13. On the PX4 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 2.

param.name: BATT_BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

param.name: BATT_BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_BATT_APM_PERVOLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17.

param.name: BATT_BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for relay control.

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4, but must be set correctly on an APM2. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_MPU6K_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

param.name: INAV_TC_XY
param.documentation: Time constant for GPS and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases GPS impact on position estimate

param.name: INAV_TC_Z
param.documentation: Time constant for baro and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases barometers impact on altitude estimate

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_LOIT_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.name: BATT_BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

param.name: BATT_BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_BATT_APM_PERVOLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17.

param.name: BATT_BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: SPRAYER_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

param.name: SPRAYER_PUMP_RATE
param.documentation: Desired pump speed when travelling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

param.name: SPRAYER_SPINNER
param.documentation: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

param.name: SPRAYER_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

param.name: SPRAYER_PUMP_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

param.name: GND_ABS_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: GND_TEMP
param.documentation: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

param.name: GND_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: FENCE_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the fence functionality

param.name: FENCE_TYPE
param.documentation: Enabled fence types held as bitmask

param.humanName: Action to perform when the limit is breached
param.name: FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on fence breach

param.name: FENCE_ALT_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: FENCE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Circle fence radius which when breached will cause an RTL

param.name: FENCE_MARGIN
param.documentation: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence to avoid a breach

param.name: GPSGLITCH_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) gps glitch protection

param.name: H_SV1_POS
param.documentation: This is the angular location of swash servo #1.

param.name: H_SV2_POS
param.documentation: This is the angular location of swash servo #2.

param.name: H_SV3_POS
param.documentation: This is the angular location of swash servo #3.

param.name: H_ROL_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum allowable roll of the swash plate.

param.name: H_PIT_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum allowable pitch of the swash plate.

param.name: H_COL_MIN
param.documentation: This controls the lowest possible servo position for the swashplate.

param.name: H_COL_MAX
param.documentation: This controls the highest possible servo position for the swashplate.

param.name: H_COL_MID
param.documentation: This is the swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Assymetrical blades).

param.name: H_GYR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable an external rudder gyro control which means outputting a gain on channel 7 and using a simpler heading control algorithm. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the external gyro gain on channel 7 and revert to a more complex yaw control algorithm.

param.name: H_SWASH_TYPE
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 will configure for a 3-servo CCPM. Setting this to 1 will configure for mechanically mixed "H1".

param.name: H_GYR_GAIN
param.documentation: This is the PWM which is passed to the external gyro when external gyro is enabled.

param.name: H_SV_MAN
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will pass radio inputs directly to servos. Setting this to Disabled(0) will enable Arducopter control of servos. This is only meant to be used by the Mission Planner using swash plate set-up.

param.name: H_PHANG
param.documentation: This corrects for phase angle errors of the helicopter main rotor head. For example if pitching the swash forward also induces a roll, that effect can be offset with this parameter.

param.name: H_COLYAW
param.documentation: This is a feed-forward compensation to automatically add rudder input when collective pitch is increased.

param.name: H_GOV_SETPOINT
param.documentation: This is the PWM which is passed to the external motor governor when external governor is enabled.

param.name: H_RSC_MODE
param.documentation: This sets which ESC control mode is active.

param.name: H_RSC_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the time the RSC takes to ramp up to full speed (Soft Start).

param.name: H_FLYBAR_MODE
param.documentation: This sets which acro mode is active. (0) is Flybarless (1) is Mechanical Flybar

param.name: H_STAB_COL_MIN
param.documentation: This is the minimum collective setpoint in Stabilize Mode

param.name: H_STAB_COL_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum collective setpoint in Stabilize Mode

param.name: MOT_TCRV_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether a curve is used to linearize the thrust produced by the motors

param.name: MOT_TCRV_MIDPCT
param.documentation: Set the pwm position that produces half the maximum thrust of the motors

param.name: MOT_TCRV_MAXPCT
param.documentation: Set to the lowest pwm position that produces the maximum thrust of the motors. Most motors produce maximum thrust below the maximum pwm value that they accept.

param.name: MOT_SPIN_ARMED
param.documentation: Controls whether motors always spin when armed (must be below THR_MIN)

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RC1_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_REV

param.name: RC2_DZ

param.name: RC12_TRIM

param.name: STEER2SRV_T_CONST
param.documentation: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved bank angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

param.name: STEER2SRV_P
param.documentation: The proportional gain for steering. This should be approximately equal to the diameter of the turning circle of the vehicle at low speed and maximum steering angle

param.name: STEER2SRV_I
param.documentation: This is the gain from the integral of steering angle. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out steady offsets due to an out of trim vehicle.

param.name: STEER2SRV_D
param.documentation: This adjusts the damping of the steering control loop. This gain helps to reduce steering jitter with vibration. It should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency steering oscillation that could overstress the vehicle.

param.name: STEER2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: This limits the number of degrees of steering in centi-degrees over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 centi-degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate unless the vehicle is severely out of trim.

param.name: STEER2SRV_MINSPD
param.documentation: This is the minimum assumed ground speed in meters/second for steering. Having a minimum speed prevents osciallations when the vehicle first starts moving. The vehicle can still driver slower than this limit, but the steering calculations will be done based on this minimum speed.

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4, but must be set correctly on an APM2. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for relay control.

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: NAVL1_PERIOD
param.documentation: Period in seconds of L1 tracking loop. This needs to be larger for less responsive airframes. The default of 30 is very conservative, and for most RC aircraft will lead to slow and lazy turns. For smaller more agile aircraft a value closer to 20 is appropriate. When tuning, change this value in small increments, as a value that is much too small (say 5 or 10 below the right value) can lead to very radical turns, and a risk of stalling.

param.name: NAVL1_DAMPING
param.documentation: Damping ratio for L1 control. Increase this in increments of 0.05 if you are getting overshoot in path tracking. You should not need a value below 0.7 or above 0.85.

param.name: SONAR_PIN
param.documentation: Analog pin that sonar is connected to.

param.name: SONAR_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between sonar reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: SONAR_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance

param.name: SONAR_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: SONAR_MIN_CM
param.documentation: minimum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

param.name: SONAR_MAX_CM
param.documentation: maximum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

param.name: SONAR_ENABLE
param.documentation: set to 1 to enable this sonar

param.name: SONAR_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables sonar measurement. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the sonar and set to 0 to disable it. This can be used to ensure that multiple sonars don't interfere with each other.

param.name: SONAR_SETTLE_MS
param.documentation: The time in milliseconds that the sonar reading takes to settle. This is only used when a STOP_PIN is specified. It determines how long we have to wait for the sonar to give a reading after we set the STOP_PIN high. For a sonar with a range of around 7m this would need to be around 50 milliseconds to allow for the sonar pulse to travel to the target and back again.

param.name: SONAR2_PIN
param.documentation: Analog pin that sonar is connected to.

param.name: SONAR2_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between sonar reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: SONAR2_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance

param.name: SONAR2_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: SONAR2_MIN_CM
param.documentation: minimum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

param.name: SONAR2_MAX_CM
param.documentation: maximum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

param.name: SONAR2_ENABLE
param.documentation: set to 1 to enable this sonar

param.name: SONAR2_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables sonar measurement. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the sonar and set to 0 to disable it. This can be used to ensure that multiple sonars don't interfere with each other.

param.name: SONAR2_SETTLE_MS
param.documentation: The time in milliseconds that the sonar reading takes to settle. This is only used when a STOP_PIN is specified. It determines how long we have to wait for the sonar to give a reading after we set the STOP_PIN high. For a sonar with a range of around 7m this would need to be around 50 milliseconds to allow for the sonar pulse to travel to the target and back again.

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_MPU6K_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in

param.name: MNT_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: BATT_BATT_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT_BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 13. On the PX4 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 2.

param.name: BATT_BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

param.name: BATT_BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_BATT_APM_PERVOLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17.

param.name: BATT_BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full
